text:
Candidate Name: 	Andy Whittall
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		Isle of Wight, UK
CAREER SUMMARY
Jan 2020 to date Blackberry (was Cylance)
Present: Distribution Sales Director UK&I, Middle East, Turkey, Africa, & Israel
Endpoint Security.
Responsible for the profitable growth of the BlackBerry Cylance Distributor and Partner network across the UK, Middle East, Africa, Turkey, and Israel.
Additionally, he manages a small team covering northern, central and Eastern Europe.
He has designed and implemented a Distributor rationalisation program for EMEA and recruitment of new partnerships for the African market.
Responsible for achieving the growth targets across the region, enabling, and motivating the channel to gain the best possible business outcomes. 100% growth in year 1.
2015 – 2020 Hewlett  Candidate Name: 	Andy Whittall
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		Isle of Wight, UK
CAREER SUMMARY
Jan 2020 to date Blackberry (was Cylance)
Present: Distribution Sales Director UK&I, Middle East, Turkey, Africa, & Israel
Endpoint Security.
Responsible for the profitable growth of the BlackBerry Cylance Distributor and Partner network across the UK, Middle East, Africa, Turkey, and Israel.
Additionally, he manages a small team covering northern, central and Eastern Europe.
He has designed and implemented a Distributor rationalisation program for EMEA and recruitment of new partnerships for the African market.
Responsible for achieving the growth targets across the region, enabling, and motivating the channel to gain the best possible business outcomes. 100% growth in year 1.
2015 – 2020 Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) Tech Data
Position: EMEA Business Development Manager
Created and executed business development and client acquisition strategies for this global IT solutions provider with revenue of over $36BN.
Cultivated a network of partners and customers to provide complex business services and resources.
Spearheaded the delivery of Europe-wide business expansion initiatives worth in excess of $500M.
Collaboration with numerous internal and external stakeholders to achieve project deliverables.
2007 – 2015 IBM
2013 – 2015
Position: Distributor Sales Leader – Europe, Central & Eastern Europe
Leadership and strategic oversight for the continual growth of sales revenue across the region.
Managed internal teams and distribution partners to secure future business.
Growth of 140% following an intensive sales and client acquisition program.
Successfully implemented sales and operational policies to drive consistency, efficiency, and profitability.
2012 – 2013
Position: Inside Sales Leader, Europe – Information Management & Big Data
Information Management and Big Data team implemented sophisticated business transformation projects involving a Pan-European Telesales operation spread across 20 countries.
Led the hiring, on-boarding, and training of new managers to ramp up team activity within tight deadlines.
Achieved a range of ambitious operational and financial targets.
2011 – 2012
Position: Routes to Market Manager – Information Management & Big Data
Identification and roll out of alternative income streams to complement direct sales operations.
Outstanding sales revenue growth in this role having grown channel business by over 300%.
2004 – 2006 Voodoo
Position: Sales Director
E-commerce solutions. Grew from start-up to sales with 150 thriving customers.
2001 – 2004 Webscreen Technology
Position: Sales Manager EMEA
Start-up Cyber Security Vendor, from $0 to the successful sale of the company to Juniper Networks
Previous other roles with Commerce NTI, .com payment gateway provider (4 years) and Sky Television (Marketing) for 5 years
COMMENT
A successful Sales Director with a strong background in the Channel and both major Vendor and Distributor experience. With time in Direct Sales, Sales team management and Business Development roles, he is a high achiever and leads from the front.
Currently working with Cylance Cyber Security (Now BlackBerry) as the distribution Sales Leader for EMEA and with an individual contributor role across the UK, Middle East, Africa, Turkey, and Israel.
After 8 years with IBM Software Group in EMEA Leadership roles and Channel Management positions, he moved to TechData to manage the vendor relationship and develop sales in their Hewlett Packard Enterprise business across 23 countries in EMEA. He also managed the relationships with strategic Alliance Partners.
Blending large vendor experience with distribution has proved productive and enables him to bring a greater depth of understanding, insight, and strategic objectivity to the role.
Interests / Volunteering Activities:
NHS – Volunteer Community First Responder – supporting the Ambulance service with category 1 emergency call out response, when an Ambulance cannot be there in 7 minutes and he can.
Isle of Wight Search & Rescue – He is a volunteer Search Technician helping the Police in searches for missing, vulnerable people.
Sports: Gold Medallist - Na

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
